name: Sediment supply
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Fine input aligns with transport, unless higher turbidity/fines are historically normal (e.g., blackwater).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Combine slope, soils, land cover, and roads in GIS to estimate relative sediment supply and delivery risk to the channel network.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Low predicted sediment supply and delivery risk relative to similar watersheds in the region.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Low to moderate predicted sediment supply and delivery risk.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Moderate to high predicted sediment supply and delivery risk.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Very high predicted sediment supply and delivery risk with likely chronic instability.

references: DEM slope, SSURGO soils, and roads/land cover layers.
